tirana.name: Tirana
tirana.description: Tirana is the vibrant capital and largest city of Albania, known for its colorful buildings, mix of architectural styles, and youthful energy. Founded in 1614 as an Ottoman market town, it became Albania's capital in 1920 and has since transformed into a dynamic European city with a unique communist-era heritage and thriving cultural scene.

founding.significance: Established as a strategic trading post on caravan routes

key_facts: Market town with mosques and bazaars
Proclaimed capital in 1920 after Congress of Lushnjë
Italian neoclassical buildings added during Zog's reign
Skanderbeg Square developed as civic center
Massive bunker construction (175,000+ including Bunk'Art sites)
Pyramid of Tirana built (1988) as Enver Hoxha Museum
Blloku district restricted to communist elite
Colorful building facades initiative (2000s under Mayor Rama)

languages.name: Italian
languages.notes: Common due to historical ties and media influence

landmarks.name: Et'hem Bey Mosque
landmarks.note: Historic mosque with rare nature frescoes

landmarks.name: Resurrection of Christ Orthodox Cathedral
landmarks.note: One of Balkans' largest Orthodox churches

landmarks.name: St. Paul's Catholic Cathedral
landmarks.note: Modern architecture with striking bell tower

cultural_firsts: First public painting of buildings initiative in Europe (2000s)
Only capital with a pyramid-shaped former dictator museum
First Balkan city to host European Youth Capital (2022)

cultural_institutions.name: National History Museum
cultural_institutions.highlight: Massive mosaic facade depicting Albanian history

cultural_institutions.name: Bunk'Art 1 & 2
cultural_institutions.highlight: Cold War bunkers converted to museums
unique_features: Multimedia exhibits on daily life under communism

cultural_institutions.name: National Gallery of Arts
cultural_institutions.highlight: Socialist realist and contemporary Albanian art

cultural_tips.advice: Handshakes common, cheek kisses between friends
Ask permission before photographing religious sites/military areas
10% in restaurants, round up taxi fares

historical.name: Skanderbeg Square
features: Equestrian statue of national hero Skanderbeg
Colorful stone mosaics from across Albania
historical.tip: Visit at sunset for beautiful lighting on the buildings

historical.name: Pyramid of Tirana
historical.history: Originally Enver Hoxha Museum (1988), now IT education center
historical.architecture: Brutalist (designed by Hoxha's daughter and son-in-law)
features: Popular spot for local youth to climb
Ongoing renovation for digital education hub

historical.name: Postbllok Memorial
features: Segment of Berlin Wall (gift from Germany)

museums.name: Bunk'Art 1
museums.history: 5-story underground nuclear bunker for communist elite
features: Original blast doors and communication systems
Exhibits on daily life under communism

museums.name: Bunk'Art 2
museums.difference: Focuses on police persecution vs Bunk'Art 1's political focus

religious_sites.name: Et'hem Bey Mosque
religious_sites.uniqueness: Survived communist atheism period (declared cultural monument)
features: Rare nature frescoes (uncommon in Islamic art)
Active mosque with welcoming attitude to visitors
religious_sites.visiting_hours: Outside prayer times, modest dress required
religious_sites.tip: Climb Clock Tower next door for panoramic views

religious_sites.name: Bektashi World Center
religious_sites.significance: Global headquarters of Bektashi Sufi order
features: Hidden terrace with best panoramic view
religious_sites.cultural_note: Bektashism known for tolerance and mysticism

religious_sites.name: Resurrection of Christ Orthodox Cathedral
features: One of Balkans' largest Orthodox churches

natural.name: Mount Dajti National Park
access: Dajti Ekspres Cable Car (15 min ride, longest in Balkans)

urban_experiences.name: Blloku District
urban_experiences.history: Former restricted area for communist elite (only Politburo members allowed)
urban_experiences.transformation: Now trendy nightlife and shopping hub
features: Enver Hoxha's former residence (now closed to public)

urban_experiences.name: Tirana Art Lab
urban_experiences.best_area: Former industrial zones near Lana River

cultural.description: Explore Tirana's layered history from Ottoman to communist eras

adventure.description: Outdoor activities in and around the city

activities.name: Pëllumbas Cave
activities.details: Karst cave with hiking trail through Erzen Valley

gastronomy.description: Traditional Albanian cuisine with modern twists

items.name: Byrek
items.description: Flaky phyllo pastry with cheese, meat or spinach

items.name: Tavë kosi
items.description: National dish - baked lamb with yogurt and rice

experiences.name: Food Tours
highlights: New Bazaar market visit (tasting local produce)
Traditional restaurants like Oda (19th century setting)
Modern interpretations at Mullixhiu (slow food movement)

initiatives.name: Orbital Forest
initiatives.goal: Planting 2 million trees around Tirana by 2030

signature_dishes.name: Byrek
signature_dishes.description: Flaky phyllo pastry with cheese, meat or spinach filling

signature_dishes.name: Tavë kosi
signature_dishes.description: National dish of baked lamb with yogurt and rice
signature_dishes.origin_story: Created for Ottoman officials visiting Elbasan

signature_dishes.name: Fërgesë
signature_dishes.description: Creamy baked dish with peppers, tomatoes and cheese

restaurants.name: Mullixhiu
restaurants.concept: Farm-to-table with creative twists by chef Bledar Kola

street_food.name: Qofte në bukë
street_food.description: Meatballs in bread with onions and yogurt

street_food.name: Petulla
street_food.description: Fried dough balls served with honey or cheese

bargaining_tips: Common in markets for non-food items

nightlife.overview: Tirana's nightlife is vibrant and diverse, centered around the Blloku district but spreading to other areas. Nightlife starts late, with most bars filling after 10pm and clubs after midnight.

venues.name: Salt
venues.knowledgeable: Staff can recommend perfect local wine

alternative.name: Zgara Tirones
alternative.concept: Grill house by day, alternative bar by night

cultural_nightlife.name: National Theater of Opera and Ballet

offerings.note: Mix of Italian classics and Albanian works

nightlife_tips.details: Smart casual in upscale venues (no shorts in clubs)
Taxi apps recommended for late-night transport
Generally safe, but avoid unlicensed taxis
Many places don't accept cards - bring lek

transfers.tip: Use Speed Taxi app for fixed price

local_transport.safety: Well-lit at night in central areas

local_transport.caution: Limited bike lanes - defensive riding needed

options.departure: Every hour from Zogu i Zi

details: International agencies at airport
Average cost: €25-40/day
Requires international driving permit
City center: congested with limited parking
Countryside: improving but some rough patches
Blue zones: paid parking (100 lek/hour)
Shopping centers: often free with validation

booking_tips.details: Smaller hotels may offer better rates via email

hidden_gems.name: Bunk'Art 2
hidden_gems.description: Smaller but more centrally located than Bunk'Art 1, focusing on secret police history
hidden_gems.tip: Visit early to avoid school groups

hidden_gems.name: Tanners' Bridge
hidden_gems.description: 18th-century Ottoman stone bridge hidden between modern buildings
hidden_gems.historical_note: Part of ancient trade route to Istanbul

hidden_gems.name: Bektashi World Center Terrace
hidden_gems.description: Secret panoramic view of Tirana from religious complex

hidden_gems.name: Former Kinostudio
hidden_gems.description: Abandoned communist-era film studios with socialist murals
hidden_gems.caution: Unofficial access - explore at own risk

hidden_gems.name: Kodra e Diellit Stairs
hidden_gems.description: Colorful staircase neighborhood with local art project

transport.departure: Every hour from Zogu i Zi

transport.tip: Combine with Durrës for full day

details: Cash preferred for small transactions
ATMs widely available (avoid Euronet for better rates)
Credit cards accepted in hotels/upscale restaurants
Restaurants: 10% (check if service included)
Taxis: round up fare
Tour guides: 5-10€ for full day

nonverbal_tips.details: Nodding may mean 'no', shaking head 'yes' - confirm verbally
Pointing with whole hand more polite than finger

details: Tirana is very safe by European standards
Normal precautions against pickpockets in crowded areas
Well-lit central areas secure at night
Avoid poorly lit parks after dark
Use licensed taxis (official ones are white)
Avoid unmarked cars offering rides
Available at airport or city shops (need passport)
Best providers: Vodafone, One, ALBtelecom
Cost: ~1000 lek for 10GB data
Modest dress for religious sites (shoulders/knees covered)
Upscale restaurants: smart casual
Albanians are very hospitable - may invite you for coffee
Accepting small gifts (like sweets) is polite

advice.details: Tap water generally safe but bottled recommended for visitors

details: Widely available (look for 'Farmaci')
Many pharmacists speak English

itineraries.name: Tirana in 1 Day
morning: Et'hem Bey Mosque & Clock Tower visit
National History Museum (focus on ground floor highlights)

itineraries.name: 3-Day Exploration
day1: Full communism tour (Bunk'Art 1, House of Leaves, Pyramid)
Evening food tour of New Bazaar
day2: Morning at Mount Dajti (cable car & short hike)
Evening jazz at Jazz Club Tirana

local_secrets.details: Family-run bakery near Orthodox Cathedral - amazing byrek for 50 lek
Top floor of TID Tower (pretend you're going to Sky Bar)
Visit Skanderbeg Square at 8am for perfect photos
Artificial Lake west side - where locals picnic away from tourists

suggestions: Buy direct from artisans at New Bazaar
Choose traditional handmade souvenirs over imports
